name: platform
description: platform

name: developer
description: Who developed this game

name: publisher
description: Who published this game

name: releasedate
description: Initial release date/country

name: otherPlatforms
description: Other platforms you can play this game on

name: series
description: Series

name: players
description: Number of simultaneous human players

name: structure
description: Game structure. It can be linear, branching, or stage select.

name: difficulty
description: Overall game difficulty

name: gangsize
description: Maximum number of onscreen opponents

name: variety
description: Variety elements such as bonus rounds, shooter sections, or RPG mechanics

name: playtime
description: Average time necessary to beat the game

name: buttons
description: List of buttons used to control the game

The nature of the combo attack in this game. Linear always plays the same sequence, distance means different attacks come out based on distance from opponents, and freeform means you can change your combo with directionals or button presses.

name: grabs
description: The nature of grabs in this game. Contact means you touch the opponent any time, while after stun means you have to hit them a few times first.

name: dashing
description: How dashes are executed, if they exist at all.

name: EnemyHBars
description: Are enemy health bars displayed? Do they have names?

name: itemPickup
description: How you pick up items. Either by just coming in contact with them or pressing a button when nearby.

name: itemStay
description: How long items remain in the game. Either they fade away after some time or stay forever.

name: weaponsStay
description: How long weapons last. Either they have durability or ammo and are expended after a few hits, or they last as long as you hold them.

name: deathBlow
description: How death-blow attacks work. They can take some health, require energy, or sometimes require stock.

name: friendlyFire
description: Whether or not your attacks affect other players.

name: charSwitch
description: When you can switch characters. Usually on death, but sometimes between stages or not at all.

name: groundHit
description: If you can attack grounded opponents.

name: revive
description: What happens when you come back from death. Can grant invincibility, knockdown, and/or an attack.

name: restore
description: When your health is restored. Usually after a stage is over but sometimes through RPG mechanics and sometimes only by eating food.

name: artStyle
description: The game's overall artistic style.

name: sprites
description: The size of the character sprites.

name: setting
description: The game's aesthetic setting.

name: focus
description: What the combat engine focuses on. Can be hand-to-hand, weapons, and rarely projectiles.

name: music
description: Overall musical style.

name: tone
description: The game's overall tone. Can be humorous, lighthearted, or serious.

name: fighters
description: Number of playable characters.

name: stages
description: Total number of stages, aka levels or rounds.
Total number of unique enemies. Generally color-swaps are not counted.

name: bosses
description: Total number of unique bosses.

name: weapons
description: How many usable weapons there are in the game. This refers only to items, not to weapons permanently equipped by a character in weapons-based brawlers.

name: lives
description: Number of lives per credit.

name: continues
description: How many continues you get for a credit.

name: extend
description: Point score that awards an extra life once achieved.
